content: remily knits steek this coffee cozy by rachel henry ©remilyknits steeking is technique used to safely and securely cut your knitting to create holes where you want them it is frequently used with complex colorwork sweaters because it is easier and faster to knit colorwork in the round it can be scary to steek a big sweater so i created this scaled-down steeking project to help knitters try out the technique fearlessly think of this project as a mini-sweater vest for your coffee cup the cozy is worked in the round with stranded colorwork to create a classic fair-isle pattern then follow the step-by-step guide to steeking with a crocheted reinforcement you can do it a word about fiber size to fit a 20 oz coffee cup although it is theoretically possible to steek any kind of yarn yarn cascade 220 heathers 100 % wool 220 yds per it works best with yarn that felts naturally grippy-grabby yarn 100g hank colors #2448 a dark blue 39 yds #9456 that felts also holds onto itself inthe 75mm needles dpns or circs f/3 75 mm crochet hook sharp scissors stitch markers tapestry a word about color needle notions three ½ buttons it s fun to play with color in colorwork projects although you can of course choose any colors you like to achieve something like the sample choose colors that contrast and harmonize as follows special abbreviations see last page for a list of standard abbreviations for this project the background colors are a and b choose a dark yarn for a and medium shadein the same color family blco backward loop cast-on make a loop with the for b the foreground colors are c and d choose a working yarn and place it on the needle backward so that it contrasting color family in a medium shade for c and a does not unwind lighter shade for d the pop color is e choose a very light or very bright color from a neutral or even a third color family 1 pattern the cozy is knit from the bottom up the ribbing at the bottom and top is worked flat the colorwork
